rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about rules.

Rules help teens understand what is expected of them.

Teens are more likely to follow rules if you create the rules WITH your teen and praise them for it!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about rules.

Rules help teens understand what is expected of them.

Teens are more likely to follow rules if you create the rules WITH your teen and praise them for it!

media_title.eng: Should rules be important for you and your family? Tap play to find out

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is rules.

Rules promote peace within the household and promote understanding amongst family members.

Rules promote responsibilities for each family member; therefore, it is important to have family rules.

A household with family rules lives in peace.

rows.media_title: Should rules be important for you and your family? Tap play to find out
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is rules.

Rules promote peace within the household and promote understanding amongst family members.

Rules promote responsibilities for each family member; therefore, it is important to have family rules.

A household with family rules lives in peace.

rows.text_1_facilitator: When we make rules together, teens see that rules are not there to control them but to make sure everyone is safe and respected.

text_1_facilitator.eng: When we make rules together, teens see that rules are not there to control them but to make sure everyone is safe and respected.

media_title.eng: Rules worked for @data.characters.media_male_6.name and his teens. Tap play to hear more

media_transcript.eng:
Before I was only seen as the judge and punisher, coming in when a problem was already big. I was always blaming my wife that she was not being strict with the children and making me look like a bad person, and my wife blamed me for not being around. 

Now that we learned how to create family rules together, I am part of family conversations from the start. It makes me feel closer to my children and my wife.

rows.media_title: Rules worked for @data.characters.media_male_6.name and his teens. Tap play to hear more
rows.media_transcript:
Before I was only seen as the judge and punisher, coming in when a problem was already big. I was always blaming my wife that she was not being strict with the children and making me look like a bad person, and my wife blamed me for not being around. 

Now that we learned how to create family rules together, I am part of family conversations from the start. It makes me feel closer to my children and my wife.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let‚Äôs see how @data.characters.f1_mother.name, @data.characters.f1_father.name, and their son, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name created a new rule together.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let‚Äôs see how @data.characters.f1_mother.name, @data.characters.f1_father.name, and their son, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name created a new rule together.

character_1_text.eng: We want you to have fun, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, but we are also worried about you staying out late. Do you know why?

character_2_text.eng: Because you want me to have enough time for my schoolwork and chores?

rows.character_1_text: We want you to have fun, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, but we are also worried about you staying out late. Do you know why?
rows.character_2_text: Because you want me to have enough time for my schoolwork and chores?

rows.character_1_text: That is right. It is also not safe in this area to be outside after sunset.

character_1_text.eng: That is right. It is also not safe in this area to be outside after sunset.

character_2_text.eng: What do you think would be a good time for you to be home?

rows.character_2_text: What do you think would be a good time for you to be home?

character_2_text.eng: That is a bit late, what about 6pm?

rows.character_2_text: That is a bit late, what about 6pm?

rows.character_1_text: Maybe we can agree I will come home at 6pm on school nights and 10pm on Fridays and Saturdays?

character_1_text.eng: Maybe we can agree I will come home at 6pm on school nights and 10pm on Fridays and Saturdays?

character_2_text.eng: Yes, great. From now on, our household rule is that you need to come home at 6pm on school nights and 10pm on Fridays and Saturdays. But you always walk home with a friend. Okay?

character_3_text.eng: But you will always make sure you walk home with a friend, okay?

rows.character_2_text: Yes, great. From now on, our household rule is that you need to come home at 6pm on school nights and 10pm on Fridays and Saturdays. But you always walk home with a friend. Okay?
rows.character_3_text: But you will always make sure you walk home with a friend, okay?

character_2_text.eng: Thank you very much, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, for helping to come up with a good rule together.

rows.character_2_text: Thank you very much, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, for helping to come up with a good rule together.

character_1_text.eng: Thank you, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, for coming home on time. After you finish your schoolwork, we can have your favourite meal for dinner.

character_2_text.eng: We are proud to see how responsible you are becoming.

rows.character_1_text: Thank you, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name, for coming home on time. After you finish your schoolwork, we can have your favourite meal for dinner.
rows.character_2_text: We are proud to see how responsible you are becoming.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_6_image_asset: How do you think @data.characters.f1_son_18.name knew his parents appreciated him?
rows.text_1_facilitator: Let's think about what happened in this story.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let's think about what happened in this story.

quiz_1_question.eng: What went well when @data.characters.f1_son_18.name and his parents made a rule together?

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: They discussed the reasons behind the rule

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That is right, making clear rules together in a calm and positive way works so well!

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_mother.name and @data.characters.f1_father.name listened to their son, @data.characters.f1_son_18.name's suggestions

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That is right, making clear rules together in a calm and positive way works so well!

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: The rule was clear, specific and fair

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That is right, making clear rules together in a calm and positive way works so well!

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_mother.name praised @data.characters.f1_son_18.name for helping to make the rule

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: That is right, making clear rules together in a calm and positive way works so well!

quiz_1_option_5_text.eng: Both caregivers and their teen were involved

quiz_1_feedback_5.eng: That‚Äôs right. When teens, fathers and mothers are involved in a calm and positive way, creating clear rules and following them becomes a shared responsibility for everyone

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Exactly - a positive response makes all the difference!

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_mother.name and @data.characters.f1_father.name rewarded him when he followed the rule

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Exactly - a positive response makes all the difference!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Setting rules together also helps teens manage friendships and relationships. Talking about boyfriends and girlfriends is not always easy ‚Äì for parents or teens ‚Äì but very important. Think back: Would clear, calm guidance have helped you as a teen?

Let's see how @data.characters.f1_mother.name handles this conversation.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Setting rules together also helps teens manage friendships and relationships. Talking about boyfriends and girlfriends is not always easy ‚Äì for parents or teens ‚Äì but very important. Think back: Would clear, calm guidance have helped you as a teen?

Let's see how @data.characters.f1_mother.name handles this conversation.

character_2_text.eng: (_calmly_) Sure, my darling. What is the matter?

rows.character_2_text: (_calmly_) Sure, my darling. What is the matter?

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.boyfriend_1.name wants us to study together tomorrow. I really like him but I am not sure what to do.

character_2_text.eng: (ü§î_thinking to herself_) How has my daughter grown up so fast? What now? Take a deep breath‚Ä¶

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.boyfriend_1.name wants us to study together tomorrow. I really like him but I am not sure what to do.
rows.character_2_text: (ü§î_thinking to herself_) How has my daughter grown up so fast? What now? Take a deep breath‚Ä¶

rows.character_1_text:
(_calmly_) Thank you for sharing this with me, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. I know that you like @data.characters.boyfriend_1.name a lot, he is a charming boy and he does great at school, but you are only 16 and he is 18.

I feel worried that it is not safe for you to be alone with him. He might pressure you into doing something that you are not prepared to do.

I don‚Äôt want to tell you who you can see but we need to have some rules about how you spend time together.

character_1_text.eng:
(_calmly_) Thank you for sharing this with me, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. I know that you like @data.characters.boyfriend_1.name a lot, he is a charming boy and he does great at school, but you are only 16 and he is 18.

I feel worried that it is not safe for you to be alone with him. He might pressure you into doing something that you are not prepared to do.

I don‚Äôt want to tell you who you can see but we need to have some rules about how you spend time together.

rows.character_1_text: What do you think would be a fair rule about how you spend time together?

character_1_text.eng: What do you think would be a fair rule about how you spend time together?

character_2_text.eng: How about, we can spend time together if there is an adult with us?

rows.character_2_text: How about, we can spend time together if there is an adult with us?

rows.character_1_text: That would be fine as long as his parents also know. I will chat with his mother when I see her later today. And after you get back, we can talk about how it went.

character_1_text.eng: That would be fine as long as his parents also know. I will chat with his mother when I see her later today. And after you get back, we can talk about how it went.

character_2_text.eng: _(hugs @data.characters.f1_mother.name)_ Okay. Thank you for coming up with a plan together, @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name.

rows.character_2_text: _(hugs @data.characters.f1_mother.name)_ Okay. Thank you for coming up with a plan together, @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name did well by finding solutions together with @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. But this can be hard to do.

Many parents want to help their teens but find it difficult to talk about sensitive topics, like body changes and relationships.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name did well by finding solutions together with @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. But this can be hard to do.

Many parents want to help their teens but find it difficult to talk about sensitive topics, like body changes and relationships.

text_2.eng: Here are some questions from other parents to help you begin.

quiz_1_question.eng:
Who should start the conversation about body changes and intimate relationships? 
Try selecting each option for more tips!

rows.text_2: Here are some questions from other parents to help you begin.
rows.quiz_1_question:
Who should start the conversation about body changes and intimate relationships? 
Try selecting each option for more tips!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
This is not quite right. 

Remember, friends can sometimes mislead or have wrong information themselves.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This is not quite right. 

Remember, friends can sometimes mislead or have wrong information themselves.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
This is not quite right. 

Your teen might feel uncomfortable or scared to start that conversation with you.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This is not quite right. 

Your teen might feel uncomfortable or scared to start that conversation with you.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Yes, you may need to start the conversation - and it‚Äôs okay to feel shy. Be open and use the right words for any body parts you discuss (like breasts, penis, or vagina).

You can practise with a friend and ask a health worker or social worker for more information. The more you know, the better you can help your teen.

And remember, it‚Äôs also okay not to know everything. You can say, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure - let me find out and tell you later.‚Äù

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Yes, you may need to start the conversation - and it‚Äôs okay to feel shy. Be open and use the right words for any body parts you discuss (like breasts, penis, or vagina).

You can practise with a friend and ask a health worker or social worker for more information. The more you know, the better you can help your teen.

And remember, it‚Äôs also okay not to know everything. You can say, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure - let me find out and tell you later.‚Äù

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Yes, you can ask another trusted adult to start this conversation with your teen if that would help your teen open up. 

Talk to that adult beforehand and help them be open and use the right words for any body parts they discuss (like breasts, penis, or vagina).

They can practise with you and ask a health worker or social worker for more information. The more they know, the better they can help your teen.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Yes, you can ask another trusted adult to start this conversation with your teen if that would help your teen open up. 

Talk to that adult beforehand and help them be open and use the right words for any body parts they discuss (like breasts, penis, or vagina).

They can practise with you and ask a health worker or social worker for more information. The more they know, the better they can help your teen.

quiz_1_question.eng:
When is the right time to start talking about body changes and intimate relationships?
Try selecting each option for more tips!

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: When you find out they have a boyfriend or girlfriend

rows.quiz_1_question:
When is the right time to start talking about body changes and intimate relationships?
Try selecting each option for more tips!
rows.quiz_1_option_1_text: When you find out they have a boyfriend or girlfriend

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That‚Äôs not quite right.

Teens need to learn about body changes and relationships early, so they are prepared and can make good choices.

If you find out your teen is having sex, try to stay calm and share your worries gently. Getting angry can make it harder for your teen to talk to you.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That‚Äôs not quite right.

Teens need to learn about body changes and relationships early, so they are prepared and can make good choices.

If you find out your teen is having sex, try to stay calm and share your worries gently. Getting angry can make it harder for your teen to talk to you.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Age 10 is when a lot of children start to enter puberty, so they need to already understand how their bodies and feelings may change.

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Age 10 is when a lot of children start to enter puberty, so they need to already understand how their bodies and feelings may change.

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That's right! 

Age 10 is when a lot of children start to enter puberty, so they need to already understand how their bodies and feelings may change.

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That's right! 

Age 10 is when a lot of children start to enter puberty, so they need to already understand how their bodies and feelings may change.

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
It‚Äôs good to start talking about body changes and relationships early - by gently answering your child‚Äôs questions.

You don‚Äôt need to explain everything. Just give simple, honest answers that match their age and understanding.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
It‚Äôs good to start talking about body changes and relationships early - by gently answering your child‚Äôs questions.

You don‚Äôt need to explain everything. Just give simple, honest answers that match their age and understanding.

quiz_1_question.eng:
How can I best keep my teen safe?
Try selecting each option for more tips!

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: I determine what my teen can and cannot do

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: I keep information or bad influences away from them

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: I build a healthy trusting relationship with my teen

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: I discuss consequences and solutions with my teen

quiz_1_option_6_text.eng: I emphasize that pressure is never okay

rows.quiz_1_question:
How can I best keep my teen safe?
Try selecting each option for more tips!
rows.quiz_1_option_1_text: I determine what my teen can and cannot do
rows.quiz_1_option_2_text: I keep information or bad influences away from them
rows.quiz_1_option_3_text: I build a healthy trusting relationship with my teen
rows.quiz_1_option_4_text: I discuss consequences and solutions with my teen
rows.quiz_1_option_6_text: I emphasize that pressure is never okay

rows.text_1_facilitator:
This may not work.

When we try to control too much, teens may do the opposite of what we want.

But when we guide them and give them space to make choices, they often act more responsibly.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This may not work.

When we try to control too much, teens may do the opposite of what we want.

But when we guide them and give them space to make choices, they often act more responsibly.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
This may not work. 

Teens get pressure and information from many places we can‚Äôt control.

As parents, we can guide and prepare them to know what is right or wrong‚Äîand help them feel confident to make good decisions.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This may not work. 

Teens get pressure and information from many places we can‚Äôt control.

As parents, we can guide and prepare them to know what is right or wrong‚Äîand help them feel confident to make good decisions.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That‚Äôs right.

When your teen feels trusted, they are more likely to trust you and come to you for advice or help.

Praise and thank them when they share. Avoid judging, so they feel safe to talk to you again.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That‚Äôs right.

When your teen feels trusted, they are more likely to trust you and come to you for advice or help.

Praise and thank them when they share. Avoid judging, so they feel safe to talk to you again.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That‚Äôs right.

Good decisions come from thinking through the consequences. Talk openly with your teen when there‚Äôs a problem. Listen to each other and find solutions together.

Each challenge is an opportunity to teach your teen that actions have consequences‚Äîand you can handle them as a team.

Remember to praise each other for working through tough situations together.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That‚Äôs right.

Good decisions come from thinking through the consequences. Talk openly with your teen when there‚Äôs a problem. Listen to each other and find solutions together.

Each challenge is an opportunity to teach your teen that actions have consequences‚Äîand you can handle them as a team.

Remember to praise each other for working through tough situations together.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That‚Äôs right.

To stay safe, your teen needs to know the difference between respectful behaviours and relationships, and unhealthy ones.

Respectful relationships feel caring, safe, and fair. Unhealthy ones involve pressure, discomfort, or feeling unsafe.

No one should be forced to do something they‚Äôre not okay with.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That‚Äôs right.

To stay safe, your teen needs to know the difference between respectful behaviours and relationships, and unhealthy ones.

Respectful relationships feel caring, safe, and fair. Unhealthy ones involve pressure, discomfort, or feeling unsafe.

No one should be forced to do something they‚Äôre not okay with.

quiz_1_question.eng:
How can I help prevent my teen from having sex too young?
Try selecting each option for more tips!

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: Keep any information about sex away from them

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: Forbid them to have a boyfriend or girlfriend

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: Have an open discussion on how and why they could wait to have sex

rows.quiz_1_question:
How can I help prevent my teen from having sex too young?
Try selecting each option for more tips!
rows.quiz_1_option_1_text: Keep any information about sex away from them
rows.quiz_1_option_2_text: Forbid them to have a boyfriend or girlfriend
rows.quiz_1_option_3_text: Have an open discussion on how and why they could wait to have sex

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That‚Äôs not quite right.

Teens hear many things about sex‚Äîfrom school, friends, or social media. Some of it is wrong.

Knowing about sex doesn‚Äôt mean they are having sex. Good information helps them stay safe and understand why waiting to have sex can be a good choice.

Without this knowledge, they may face problems, like not knowing how pregnancy happens or the risks of sex.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That‚Äôs not quite right.

Teens hear many things about sex‚Äîfrom school, friends, or social media. Some of it is wrong.

Knowing about sex doesn‚Äôt mean they are having sex. Good information helps them stay safe and understand why waiting to have sex can be a good choice.

Without this knowledge, they may face problems, like not knowing how pregnancy happens or the risks of sex.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That‚Äôs not quite right.

Your teen might have a boyfriend or girlfriend and not tell you.

If you make them hide it, they may not come to you with questions or problems‚Äîand this can lead to risky situations.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That‚Äôs not quite right.

Your teen might have a boyfriend or girlfriend and not tell you.

If you make them hide it, they may not come to you with questions or problems‚Äîand this can lead to risky situations.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
That‚Äôs right.

Teens are figuring out who they are. They look to friends and media for answers, and may feel pressure to do things they‚Äôre not ready for.

Talk calmly with your teen about waiting to have sex until they feel ready, are in a safe relationship, and understand the consequences. Focus on guiding them calmly to make healthy choices.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
That‚Äôs right.

Teens are figuring out who they are. They look to friends and media for answers, and may feel pressure to do things they‚Äôre not ready for.

Talk calmly with your teen about waiting to have sex until they feel ready, are in a safe relationship, and understand the consequences. Focus on guiding them calmly to make healthy choices.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Now let's practise making rules.

Write down one important rule you would like to make with your teenager ‚Äì you will be doing this as your home practice this week.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Now let's practise making rules.

Write down one important rule you would like to make with your teenager ‚Äì you will be doing this as your home practice this week.

text_2.eng:
**Here are some examples of rules other families made:**
- ‚öΩ Teen can play outside after finishing homework
- üë™üèΩ All family members eat dinner together
- üçΩÔ∏è Teen 1 does dishes on Sunday and Monday, Teen 2 on Tuesday and Wednesday
- üíú We speak to each other politely and nicely
- üé∂ When listening to music you need to use earphones

rows.text_2:
**Here are some examples of rules other families made:**
- ‚öΩ Teen can play outside after finishing homework
- üë™üèΩ All family members eat dinner together
- üçΩÔ∏è Teen 1 does dishes on Sunday and Monday, Teen 2 on Tuesday and Wednesday
- üíú We speak to each other politely and nicely
- üé∂ When listening to music you need to use earphones

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are this week‚Äôs takeaway skills to help learn how to set rules with your teen!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are this week‚Äôs takeaway skills to help learn how to set rules with your teen!

section_1_text.eng: Household rules help to keep our teenagers safe and to understand what is expected from them. When you involve a teenager in making rules they are more likely to follow them.

section_1_extra_text.eng: Include rules for healthy relationships ‚Äî like sharing openly, showing respect, and talking to a trusted adult if something feels wrong.

section_2_text.eng: Plan rules WITH your teenager. Start with one new rule first ‚Äì you can add another one later. Discuss the reasons for the rule and listen to their views.

section_3_text.eng:
Praise your teen for planning a rule with you, and praise them for keeping it. 

Positive feedback helps teens make good choices, including in relationships.

section_4_text.eng:
Teens learn about sex and relationships from many places, and some information may be incorrect or not right for their age.

Talk calmly about body changes, respect, and consent.

Listen without judging, and guide your teen to make safe choices in relationships and online.

section_4_extra_text.eng: You do not need to have all the answers. You can ask other adults or health workers for help and information.

rows.section_1_text: Household rules help to keep our teenagers safe and to understand what is expected from them. When you involve a teenager in making rules they are more likely to follow them.
rows.section_1_extra_text: Include rules for healthy relationships ‚Äî like sharing openly, showing respect, and talking to a trusted adult if something feels wrong.
rows.section_2_text: Plan rules WITH your teenager. Start with one new rule first ‚Äì you can add another one later. Discuss the reasons for the rule and listen to their views.
rows.section_3_text:
Praise your teen for planning a rule with you, and praise them for keeping it. 

Positive feedback helps teens make good choices, including in relationships.
rows.section_4_text:
Teens learn about sex and relationships from many places, and some information may be incorrect or not right for their age.

Talk calmly about body changes, respect, and consent.

Listen without judging, and guide your teen to make safe choices in relationships and online.
rows.section_4_extra_text: You do not need to have all the answers. You can ask other adults or health workers for help and information.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
This week's home activity is to set one rule together with your teen.

Remember to praise your teen afterwards!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This week's home activity is to set one rule together with your teen.

Remember to praise your teen afterwards!

text_2.eng:
**Remember to use your skills for rule setting:**

‚öΩ Team rules: When making the rule, work together like a team. 
üîé Real rules: Agree on real rules that are clear and fair. For example, you could agree that everyone says where they are going before leaving the house.
üéâ Praise rules: Praise when rules are followed!
üíõ Relationship rules: Make rules to guide safe choices in relationships and online.

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you set one rule together with your teen this week?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Fantastic! Setting a rule together helps your teen feel involved and respected. It is a big step toward building trust and cooperation.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: You can do it! Even beginning the conversation shows your teen that their voice matters. Take it one step at a time.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. It can take time to agree on new rules. You could start by asking your teen what they think is important - small talks can lead to big changes.

rows.text_2:
**Remember to use your skills for rule setting:**

‚öΩ Team rules: When making the rule, work together like a team. 
üîé Real rules: Agree on real rules that are clear and fair. For example, you could agree that everyone says where they are going before leaving the house.
üéâ Praise rules: Praise when rules are followed!
üíõ Relationship rules: Make rules to guide safe choices in relationships and online.
rows.quiz_1_question: Can you set one rule together with your teen this week?
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Fantastic! Setting a rule together helps your teen feel involved and respected. It is a big step toward building trust and cooperation.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: You can do it! Even beginning the conversation shows your teen that their voice matters. Take it one step at a time.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: That's okay. It can take time to agree on new rules. You could start by asking your teen what they think is important - small talks can lead to big changes.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Clear, simple rules made together with your teen are not about control - they are about keeping them safe and building responsibility. When teens understand the reasons behind the rules, they are more likely to follow them.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Clear, simple rules made together with your teen are not about control - they are about keeping them safe and building responsibility. When teens understand the reasons behind the rules, they are more likely to follow them.

media_title.eng: Can teens value rules too? Hear @data.characters.media_male_7.name's story

media_transcript.eng:
As teens, we hear a lot about sex at school and online. Some of my friends said they were already having sex and told me it makes you a ‚Äúreal man,‚Äù and I was scared to tell my parents.

When we did @global.app_name, we made a family rule to ask questions instead of keeping secrets. When I shared what I‚Äôd heard, my parents stayed calm and explained what sex really means ‚Äî and that real friends never pressure you.

Now, whenever I‚Äôm unsure about something, I know I can talk to my parents and we can figure out solutions together.

rows.media_title: Can teens value rules too? Hear @data.characters.media_male_7.name's story
rows.media_transcript:
As teens, we hear a lot about sex at school and online. Some of my friends said they were already having sex and told me it makes you a ‚Äúreal man,‚Äù and I was scared to tell my parents.

When we did @global.app_name, we made a family rule to ask questions instead of keeping secrets. When I shared what I‚Äôd heard, my parents stayed calm and explained what sex really means ‚Äî and that real friends never pressure you.

Now, whenever I‚Äôm unsure about something, I know I can talk to my parents and we can figure out solutions together.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Rules are important to keep your teens safe ‚Äì not only offline, but also online. There‚Äôs more about this in the lesson on teen safety, but let‚Äôs already have a first look now!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Rules are important to keep your teens safe ‚Äì not only offline, but also online. There‚Äôs more about this in the lesson on teen safety, but let‚Äôs already have a first look now!

character_2_text.eng: Just a minute @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name, I‚Äôm finishing this Tiktok video.

rows.character_2_text: Just a minute @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name, I‚Äôm finishing this Tiktok video.

rows.character_1_text: You are a really great dancer! Tell me about why you like Tiktok.

character_1_text.eng: You are a really great dancer! Tell me about why you like Tiktok.

character_2_text.eng: All my friends are on it, @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name. I have more than 600 likes and 120 followers.

rows.character_2_text: All my friends are on it, @data.characters.f1_mother_role.name. I have more than 600 likes and 120 followers.

rows.character_1_text:
I‚Äôm proud of how well you dance, @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name. But we need to make sure you are safe.

I know your friends look at Tiktok, but with an open account, there are other people who look at videos of teenagers for their own sexual needs. Sometimes they contact teenagers. They pretend to be nice but end up threatening and abusing teens.

character_1_text.eng:
I‚Äôm proud of how well you dance, @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name. But we need to make sure you are safe.

I know your friends look at Tiktok, but with an open account, there are other people who look at videos of teenagers for their own sexual needs. Sometimes they contact teenagers. They pretend to be nice but end up threatening and abusing teens.

rows.character_1_text:
Let‚Äôs look together online at how we can keep this fun for you but also safe. 

Look ‚Äì you can make your account private and control who follows you. So you can accept people you know from school and our community, but not people you don't know.

Can we make a rule together that you can use Tiktok, but with a private account? I trust you to know who to accept!

character_1_text.eng:
Let‚Äôs look together online at how we can keep this fun for you but also safe. 

Look ‚Äì you can make your account private and control who follows you. So you can accept people you know from school and our community, but not people you don't know.

Can we make a rule together that you can use Tiktok, but with a private account? I trust you to know who to accept!
